question.title: How do I sort an ArrayList by date and time in string format
question.body:
I'm currently programming a small notes app and saving everything as strings in the sharedPrefs. I would now like to sort the overview of the note entries so that the most recent entries are always displayed at the top.

The problem is when I sort on the note body, the sorting works, but not by date and time. The date is stored in the form dd.mm.yyyy and the time is in hh:mm in the sharedPrefs as a string. How can I realize that?

Here is the method that loads all the data from the sharedPref.

public static ArrayList<Note> loadAll(Context context) {
        SharedPreferences sharedPreferences = context.getSharedPreferences(STORE_PREF, Context.MODE_PRIVATE);
        ArrayList<Note> notes = new ArrayList<>();
        Set<String> noteIds = sharedPreferences.getStringSet(ID_KEY, null);

        if (noteIds != null) {
            for (String noteId : noteIds) {
                notes.add(load(context, noteId));
            }
        }

 DateTimeFormatter d;
 DateTimeFormatter t;
 if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.O) {
            d = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd.MM.yyyy");
            t = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("hh:mm");
            notes.sort(Comparator
                        .comparing(o -> LocalDate.parse(o.getDate(), d))
                    .thenComparing(o -> LocalDate.parse(o.getTime(), t)));

    }

If I limit the sorting to the date alone, it runs without errors. I can sort my list by date. But as soon as I want to use .thenComparing() my code is faulty. What am I doing wrong?

Here i have two screenshots. sorting by body and sorting by date
